        • pycheron.plotting.rankingPlot

    pycheron.plotting.rankingPlot¶

    rankPlot(st, f_name=None, model='nlnm', rank_by=None, nnm_fname=None, database=None, station=None, network=None, channel=None, location=None, session=None)[source]¶

    This takes in network level streams and ranks the plots

    Parameters:
    • st (obspy.core.stream.Stream or pycheron.db.sqllite_db.Database) – obspy stream OR Database object
    • f_name (str) – name of output file to save ranking plot
    • model (str) – Model. “nlnm” (new low noise model) or “nnm” (network noise model).
    • rank_by (numpy.ndarray) – Array of period values to rank the stations at. If none, default will be [1, 6.5, 30, 100]
    • nnm_fname (str) – If supplied, plot of network noise model will be saved
    • database (pycheron.db.sqllite_db.Database) – database object
    • station (str) – Use only if st is database object. Station name
    • network (str) – Use only if st is database object. Network name
    • channel (str) – Use only if st is database object. Channel name
    • location (str) – Use only if st is database object. Location name
    • session (str) – Use only if st is database object. Session name

    Example

    # Import libs
from obspy.clients.fdsn import Client
from plotting.rankingPlot import rankPlot
from obspy import UTCDateTime

client = Client("IRIS")
t = UTCDateTime("2019-09-10T00:00:00")
te = UTCDateTime("2019-09-10T05:00:00")
st = client.get_waveforms("CI", "*", "*", "H*", t, te)

rankPlot(st, model="gsn")
